choices.A: A metric is a report gauge used on homepages to display real-time data
choices.B: A metric is a time measurement used to report the effectiveness of workflows and SLAs
choices.C: A metric is used to measure and evaluate the effectiveness of IT service management processes
choices.D: A metric is a comparative measurement used to report the effectiveness of flows and SLAs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer to this question is definitely C. I broke up with my girlfriend. It is hard. I am already 36 years old. If I don't pass this exam, I won't have a future, so I want to do my best.
C is correct. A metric is created to evaluate fields changes in tasks.
the definition in SN Docs

A metric measures and evaluates the effectiveness of IT service management processes.

For example, a metric could measure the effectiveness of the incident resolution process by calculating how long it takes to resolve an incident.
For example, a metric could measure the effectiveness of the incident resolution process by calculating how long it takes to resolve an incident.
